required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Study of Maxillary and Mandibular Splints Used for the Treatment of Masticatory Muscle Parafunction (FEA)
clinical_study.official_title: Single-group, Comparative Biomechanical Study of Maxillary and Mandibular Splints Used for the Treatment of Masticatory Muscle Parafunction

lead_sponsor.agency: Moscow State University of Medicine and Dentistry

clinical_study.source: Moscow State University of Medicine and Dentistry

brief_summary.textblock: the purpose of this study is to clarify the rationale for the choice of the upper or lower jaw for positioning the occlusal splint

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: patients are included in a single study group. In a study group, each patient is assessed for both of the same primary treatment. The final results for each of the treatments for each patient are used for further analysis by the finite element method.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference between mandible and maxilla of occlusal splints in terms of stress-strain state and magnitude of displacement of the splinted teeth
primary_outcome.time_frame: during one appointment, up to 2 hours
primary_outcome.description: By means of the final elemental analysis, data on the stress-strain state (in MPa) and the displacement of the splinted teeth (in mm) will be obtained, individually for each patient.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference between mandible and maxilla dentition in terms of stress-strain state and magnitude of displacement of the teeth
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during one appointment, up to 2 hours
secondary_outcome.description: By means of the final elemental analysis, data on the stress-strain state (in MPa) and the displacement of the teeth (in mm) will be obtained, individually for each patient.

other_outcome.measure: Measurement of the influence of the occlusal splint use on the indicators of the stress-strain state and the magnitude of tooth displacement
other_outcome.time_frame: during one appointment, up to 2 hours
other_outcome.description: By means of the final elemental analysis, data on the stress-strain state (in MPa) and the displacement of the teeth (in mm) will be obtained, individually for each patient.

arm_group.description: In a clinical setting, participants test the closure of the occlusal splint with the antagonistic dentition. Only one of the two occlusal splints (mandibular splint and maxillary splint) is used at a time. Occlusal splints are applied separately and alternately.

intervention.description: Occlusal splints are hard, made of polymer biocompatible material using digital additive technology.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- continuous dentition
- diagnosis (by ICD*-10): K03.0 Excessive attrition of teeth
- diagnosis (by ICD-10): K07.6 Temporomandibular joint disorders
- complaints of nocturnal bruxism
- complaints of discomfort in the area of the chewing muscles
- no history of orthopedic and / or orthodontic treatment
- absence of concomitant general somatic pathologies in the stage of decompensation
- no history of psychogenic and psychosomatic disorders
- no history of cancer *ICD - Classification of Diseases
Exclusion Criteria:
- refusal of the patient during the clinical trial from further treatment

overall_official.affiliation: A.I. Yevdokimov Moscow State University of Medicine and Dentistry

facility.name: A.I. Yevdokimov Moscow State University of Medicine and Dentistry

reference.citation: Gribov D, Antonik M, Butkov D, Stepanov A, Antonik P, Kharakh Y, Pivovarov A, Arutyunov S. Personalized Biomechanical Analysis of the Mandible Teeth Behavior in the Treatment of Masticatory Muscles Parafunction. J Funct Biomater. 2021 Apr 9;12(2). pii: 23. doi: 10.3390/jfb12020023.

patient_data.ipd_description: Data obtained through this study may be provided to qualified researchers with academic interest in temporomandibular joint disorders. Data or samples shared will be coded, with no protected health information included. Approval of the request and execution of all applicable agreements (i.e. a material transfer agreement) are prerequisites to the sharing of data with the requesting party. Request will be evaluated under common conditions by Interuniversity Ethics Committee (A.I. Evdokimov Moscow State University of Medicine and Dentistry)
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data requests can be submitted starting 6 months after article publication.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Access to trial IPD (individual participant data) can be requested by qualified researchers engaging in independent scientific research, and will be provided following review and approval of a research proposal and Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP) and execution of a Data Sharing Agreement (DSA).
